title: Switch site color palette from purple to green (light + dark themes)

requirements.text: Update the app’s design tokens so the overall brand/primary color theme changes from the current purple/blue palette to a green-based palette across both light and dark mode. This includes updating the CSS variables in `frontend/src/index.css` (e.g., `--primary`, `--ring`, and any other theme tokens currently using purple/blue hues such as chart colors and accents as appropriate), and adjusting any utility classes that hardcode blue/purple colors (e.g., the `.gradient-text` utility currently using `to-blue-600`) so the UI no longer presents as purple/blue and instead reads as green-themed while maintaining good contrast and readability.

quotes: currently we are using purple like color (i think i named it correct but not sure) but i want green color theme for my website

acceptanceCriteria: In light mode, primary actions and accents (e.g., buttons, icons using `text-primary`, focus rings using `ring-ring`) appear green-toned rather than purple/blue.
In dark mode, the primary color and focus ring are also green-toned and remain clearly visible on dark backgrounds.
The `.gradient-text` utility no longer gradients to a blue color (e.g., no longer uses `to-blue-600`) and instead uses a green-compatible gradient end color.

No obvious purple/blue brand accents remain in common UI surfaces (header icon background, primary buttons, links/accents, focus styles) unless intentionally kept for non-brand semantic purposes (e.g., destructive/red).
Typography and contrast remain readable in both themes (no low-contrast green text on green backgrounds).

constraints: Do not edit files under `frontend/src/components/ui` (read-only UI component sources); achieve the theme change via tokens/CSS variables and composition elsewhere.

Keep the existing light/dark mode mechanism (Tailwind class-based `dark` mode and theme persistence) intact; only change the palette values and any hardcoded accent utility colors that conflict with the new green theme.
nonGoals: Do not redesign layouts, navigation structure, or add new pages/features.
Do not change authentication or backend behavior (backend remains unchanged).
Do not change the light/dark theme toggle behavior or persistence—only the color palette.

preferencesToAdd: Prefer a green color theme instead of purple for the website branding/accent colors.
